Summary: CM for 21.1: Insufficient snow for an avalanche forecast. Information on mountain conditions can be found on the SAIS CM blog.
SnowDistribution: Limited patchy snow in specific places. Cloudy on the tops with some bright spells. Winds approx 10mph or less
Comment: Insufficient new snowfall in the weather outlook for Tuesday to warrant an avalanche forecast. See SAIS blog for latest mountain conditions.
WeatherInfluences: Colder with occasional light snow showers above 900m. Light South-South-West winds.
SnowStability: Only a light general dusting of snow is expected above 900m. There is currently insufficient snow to warrant an avalanche forecast and no forecast will be published until conditions change. Information on mountain conditions can be found on the SAIS Creag Meagaidh blog.
ObservedWeatherInfluences: Slightly cooler than of late. Dry.
ObservedSnowStability: There is insufficient snow for an avalanche hazard report.

Summary: LO for 21/1. Insufficient snow for avalanche hazard. Refer to SAIS Blogs for mountain conditions
SnowDistribution: A dry day with clouds over the highest summits
Comment: Only light snow showers are expected with no significant accumulations.
WeatherInfluences: Light snow showers above 900m, but no significant accumulations are expected.
SnowStability: There is currently insufficient snow for an avalanche hazard and no avalanche reports will be published until conditions change. For further information please refer to the SAIS mountain blog.
ObservedWeatherInfluences: It has been a mainly dry day with the freezing level around 1200m.
ObservedSnowStability: There is currently insufficient snow for an avalanche hazard and no avalanche reports will be published until conditions change. For further information please refer to the SAIS mountain blog.

Summary: TOR for 21/1 There is currently insufficient snow for an avalanche hazard. Please refer to the SAIS mountain blog.
SnowDistribution: Limited patchy snow in specific places. Cloudy on the tops with some bright spells. Winds approx 10mph or less.
Comment: Becoming a bit colder this week with any precipitation falling as snow on the highest summits. Very unsettled by the weekend.
WeatherInfluences: Although largely dry, scattered light showers are likely, falling as sleet and snow over the highest summits as the freezing level lowers to around 900 metres overnight. Persistent fresh Southerly wind.
SnowStability: There is currently insufficient snow for an avalanche hazard and no avalanche reports will be published until conditions change. For further information please refer to the SAIS mountain blog.

Summary: GC for 21.1: Currently, insufficient snow for avalanche hazard. For further information please refer to the SAIS mountain blogs.
SnowDistribution: No snow. Fresh winds. 95 percent cloud.
WeatherInfluences: A very light dusting of snow above about 900 metres. However, accumulations are not expected to be significant.
SnowStability: There is currently insufficient snow for an avalanche hazard and no avalanche reports will be published until conditions change. For further information please refer to the SAIS mountain blog.
ObservedWeatherInfluences: Cloudy with some light rain from time to time. Freezing level above the summits
ObservedSnowStability: There is currently insufficient snow for an avalanche hazard and no avalanche reports will be published until conditions change. For further information please refer to the SAIS mountain blog.

Summary: NC for 21.1: Insufficient snow for an avalanche haz. No reports published until conditions change. For mountain info see SAIS blog
SnowDistribution: Very limited small patches of firm snow remain.  Cool with hazy sunshine. Winds 15 to 20 mph over the tops.
Comment: Looking unsettled towards the end of the week.
WeatherInfluences: Dry conditions throughout. Fresh South-Westerly winds. Freezing at summit levels overnight, falling to 900 metres during the day.
SnowStability: There is currently insufficient snow for an avalanche hazard and no avalanche reports will be published until conditions change. For further information on mountain conditions, please refer to the SAIS mountain blog.
ObservedWeatherInfluences: A dry day with long spells of hazy sunshine. Fresh South-West winds. Freezing at around summit levels.
ObservedSnowStability:
Very limited firm stable snow patches remain, mainly on North through East to Southerly aspects above 1000m. 
There is currently insufficient snow for an avalanche hazard and no avalanche reports will be published until conditions change. For further information on mountain conditions, please refer to the SAIS mountain blog.

Summary: SC for 21.1: Insufficient snow for an avalanche hazard. Please refer to the SAIS mountain blog.
WeatherInfluences: Forecast to remain dry. The freezing level will be around 1000 metres by dawn and 800 metres by the end of the day. Winds will be fresh, South-West or West-South-West throughout.
SnowStability: There is currently insufficient snow for an avalanche hazard and no avalanche reports will be published until conditions change. For further information on mountain conditions, please refer to the SAIS mountain blog.
ObservedWeatherInfluences: A dry and bright day. Light winds from the West.
ObservedSnowStability:
Very limited firm stable snow patches remain, mainly on North through East to South-East aspects above 1000m. 
There is currently insufficient snow for an avalanche hazard and no avalanche reports will be published until conditions change. For further information on mountain conditions, please refer to the SAIS mountain blog.
